verses.verse: The Ziphites<WH2130> came<WH935> to Saul<WH7586> to Gibeah,<WH1390> saying,<WH559> "Doesn't<WH1732> David hide<WH5641> himself in the hill<WH1389> of Hachilah,<WH2444> which is before<WH6440> the desert?<WH3452>"

So David<WH1732> and Abishai<WH52> came<WH935> to the people<WH5971> by night:<WH3915> and,<WH7586> behold, Saul lay<WH7901> sleeping<WH3463> within the place<WH4570> of the wagons,<WH2595> with his spear stuck<WH4600> in the ground<WH776> at his head;<WH4763> and Abner<WH74> and the people<WH5971> lay<WH7901> around him.<WH5439>

Then Abishai<WH52> said<WH559> to David,<WH1732> "God<WH430> has delivered<WH5462> up your enemy<WH341> into your hand<WH3027> this day.<WH3117> Now therefore please let me strike<WH5221> him with the spear<WH2595> to the earth<WH776> at one stroke,<WH6471> and I will not strike him the second time.<WH8138>"
David<WH1732> said<WH559> to Abishai,<WH52> "Don't<WH7843> destroy him;<WH7971> for who can put forth his hand<WH3027> against Yahweh<WH3068>'s anointed,<WH4899> and be guiltless?<WH5352>"

David<WH1732> said,<WH559> "As Yahweh<WH3068> lives,<WH2416> Yahweh<WH3068> will strike<WH5062> him;<WH3117> or his day shall come<WH935> to die;<WH4191> or he shall go<WH935> down into battle<WH4421> and perish.<WH5595>

Yahweh<WH3068> forbid<WH2486> that I should put forth<WH7971> my hand<WH3027> against Yahweh<WH3068>'s anointed;<WH4899> but now please take<WH3947> the spear<WH2595> that is at his head,<WH4763> and the jar<WH6835> of water,<WH4325> and let us go.<WH3212>"

So David<WH1732> took<WH3947> the spear<WH2595> and the jar<WH6835> of water<WH4325> from Saul<WH7586>'s head;<WH7226> and they went away:<WH3212> and no man saw<WH7200> it,<WH3045> nor knew it,<WH6974> neither did any awake; for they were all asleep,<WH3463> because a deep sleep<WH8639> from Yahweh<WH3068> was fallen on them.<WH5307>
Then David<WH1732> went over<WH5674> to the other side,<WH5676> and stood<WH5975> on the top<WH7218> of the mountain<WH2022> afar off;<WH7350> a great<WH7227> space being between them;<WH4725>

and David<WH1732> cried<WH7121> to the people,<WH5971> and to Abner<WH74> the son<WH1121> of Ner,<WH5369> saying,<WH559> "Don't<WH6030> you answer, Abner?<WH74>" Then Abner<WH74> answered,<WH6030> "Who<WH559> are you who cries<WH7121> to the king?<WH4428>"

David<WH1732> said<WH559> to Abner,<WH74> "Aren't<WH376> you a man? Who is like you in Israel?<WH3478> Why then have you not kept<WH8104> watch over your lord,<WH113> the king?<WH4428> For one<WH259> of the people<WH5971> came<WH935> in to destroy<WH7843> the king<WH4428> your lord.<WH113>

This thing<WH1697> isn't<WH2896> good that you have done.<WH6213> As Yahweh<WH3068> lives,<WH2416> you are worthy<WH1121> to die,<WH4194> because you have not kept<WH8104> watch over your lord,<WH113> Yahweh<WH3068>'s anointed.<WH4899> Now see<WH7200> where the king<WH4428>'s spear<WH2595> is,<WH6835> and the jar of water<WH4325> that was at his head.<WH4763>"

Saul<WH7586> knew<WH5234> David<WH1732>'s voice,<WH6963> and said,<WH559> "Is this your voice,<WH6963> my son<WH1121> David?<WH1732>" David<WH1732> said,<WH559> "It is my voice,<WH6963> my lord,<WH113> O king.<WH4428>"
He said,<WH559> "Why does my lord<WH113> pursue<WH7291> after<WH310> his servant?<WH5650> For what have I done?<WH6213> Or what evil<WH7451> is in my hand?<WH3027>

Now therefore,<WH113> please let my lord the king<WH4428> hear<WH8085> the words<WH1697> of his servant.<WH5650> If it is so that Yahweh<WH3068> has stirred you up<WH5496> against me,<WH7306> let him accept an offering.<WH4503> But if it is the children<WH1121> of men,<WH120> they are cursed<WH779> before<WH6440> Yahweh;<WH3068> for they have driven<WH1644> me out this day<WH3117> that I shouldn't<WH5596> cling to Yahweh<WH3068>'s inheritance,<WH5159> saying,<WH559> <WH3212> 'Go, serve<WH5647> other<WH312> gods!<WH430>'

Now therefore,<WH1818> don't let my blood fall<WH5307> to the earth<WH776> away from the presence<WH6440> of Yahweh;<WH3068> for the king<WH4428> of Israel<WH3478> has come out<WH3318> to seek<WH1245> a<WH259> flea,<WH6550> as when one hunts<WH7291> a partridge<WH7124> in the mountains.<WH2022>"

Then Saul<WH7586> said,<WH559> "I have sinned.<WH2398> Return,<WH7725> my son<WH1121> David;<WH1732> for I will no more do you harm,<WH7489> because my life<WH5315> was precious<WH3365> in your eyes<WH5869> this day.<WH3117> Behold,<WH5528> I have played the fool, and have erred<WH7686> exceedingly.<WH7235>"
David<WH1732> answered,<WH6030> "Behold<WH559> the spear,<WH2595> O king!<WH4428> Then let one<WH259> of the young men<WH5288> come over<WH5674> and get it.<WH3947>

Yahweh<WH3068> will render<WH7725> to every man<WH376> his righteousness<WH6666> and his faithfulness;<WH530> because Yahweh<WH3068> delivered<WH5414> you into my hand<WH3027> today,<WH3117> and I wouldn't<WH14> put forth<WH7971> my hand<WH3027> against Yahweh<WH3068>'s anointed.<WH4899>

Behold,<WH5315> as your life was respected<WH1431> this day<WH3117> in my eyes,<WH5869> so let my life<WH5315> be respected<WH1431> in the eyes<WH5869> of Yahweh,<WH3068> and let him deliver<WH5337> me out of all oppression.<WH6869>"

Then Saul<WH7586> said<WH559> to David,<WH1732> "You are blessed,<WH1288> my son<WH1121> David.<WH1732> You shall both do<WH6213> mightily,<WH6213> and shall surely<WH3201> prevail.<WH3201>" So David<WH1732> went<WH3212> his way,<WH1870> and Saul<WH7586> returned<WH7725> to his place.<WH4725>
